marketNews.title: Indonesia Inflation 2023 Eases to 2.61%, Below Expectations
marketNews.content:
BPS recorded that the consumer price index (CPI) in Indonesia for December 2023 eased to 2.61% year-on-year (vs November 2023: 2.86% YoY, December 2022: 5.51% YoY), lower than the consensus expectation of 2.72% YoY. The realization aligns with Bank Indonesia's target of 2-4% inflation for 2023.

The decline in the annual inflation rate in December 2023 also differs from the trend of recent years, where since 2019 inflation tended to increase at year-end. The easing in December 2023 was mainly caused by a high-base effect due to the fuel price increase at the end of 2022.

On a monthly basis, CPI inflation in December 2023 reached 0.41% month-on-month (vs November 2023: 0.38% MoM). This realization is lower than the consensus expectation of 0.5% MoM, but marks the highest monthly inflation in the past 12 months.

Core inflation in December 2023 eased to 1.8% YoY (vs November 2023: 1.87% YoY), lower than the consensus expectation of 1.85% YoY.

Based on expenditure groups, CPI inflation both monthly and yearly in December 2023 was driven by food, beverages and tobacco, which experienced 1.07% MoM and 6.18% YoY inflation. That group contributed 0.29% to monthly inflation and 1.6% to annual inflation.

Responding to the inflation data release, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed up +0.7% at 7,323 on Tuesday (2/1).

Key Takeaway: Inflation being below expectations gives Bank Indonesia room to start cutting the policy rate faster than expected, especially as the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar has strengthened to 15,473 per 1 January 2024 and there are indications of rate cuts by the Fed. Currently, consensus expects Bank Indonesia to begin cutting rates in 3Q24.

Rate cuts can have positive impact on interest-sensitive sectors such as:

- Banking: lower cost of funds can improve net interest margin.
- Property: lower mortgage rates can boost property demand. Moreover, our study finds that property developer stocks tend to rise when rates have peaked and start to be cut. See analysis in Mini Unboxing Property.
- Technology: investor financing becomes easier with lower rates.

Related stocks: $ARTO, $GOTO, $BBRI, $BBTN, $PWON, $BSDE, $SMRA

tickerNews.title: ANTM sells 49% of PT Sumberdaya Arindo to Hong Kong CBL and 10% of PT Feni Haltim
tickerNews.content: $ANTM: Aneka Tambang sells 49% of its subsidiary PT Sumberdaya Arindo to Hong Kong CBL Ltd. (HKCBL) for a transaction value of USD 416.5 million. ANTM also divests 10% of its subsidiary PT Feni Haltim to HKCBL for IDR 130.2 billion. In addition, ANTM and HKCBL sign a joint-venture agreement for an HPAL project, with ANTM contributing an initial capital of IDR 3 billion, equivalent to a 30% equity stake.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors injects approx 5.72 trillion rupiah into subsidiary PT Danusa Tambang Nusantara
tickerNews.content: $UNTR: United Tractors injects capital worth approximately IDR 5.72 trillion into its subsidiary PT Danusa Tambang Nusantara (DTN) by subscribing for 571,818 shares. The transaction is intended to meet DTN's working-capital needs. The subsidiary PT Pamapersada Nusantara (PAMA) also injects capital into DTN by subscribing for 381,212 shares, although the transaction value was not disclosed. After the transaction, UNTR holds 60% of DTN, with the remainder owned by PAMA.

tickerNews.title: PTPP records new contract worth 30.2 trillion rupiah for 11M23
tickerNews.content: $PTPP: PTPP records a new contract value of IDR 30.2 trillion for the period up to November 2023, representing 87.5% of the FY23 target of IDR 34.5 trillion. The achievement is supported by government projects contributing 41%, followed by state-owned enterprises at 34% and private projects at 25%.

tickerNews.title: Soechi Group sells ~931.48 million SOCI shares at 180 rupiah each
tickerNews.content: $SOCI: Controlling shareholder PT Soechi Group sells approximately 931.48 million SOCI shares at a price of IDR 180 per share on 28 December 2023. The transaction, valued at IDR 167.67 billion, is intended for divestment. After the transaction, PT Soechi Group's ownership in SOCI falls from 79.9% to 66.7%.

tickerNews.title: HOKI obtains 130 billion rupiah loan from affiliate PT Buyung Putra Pangan
tickerNews.content: $HOKI: Buyung Poetra Sembada obtains a loan of IDR 130 billion from its affiliate PT Buyung Putra Pangan. The loan has a tenor of 5 years with an interest rate of 8.89% per annum. The funds will be used by HOKI for raw material purchases and other operating expenses.

tickerNews.title: Uni-Charm Indonesia plans to purchase one MC12 machine for 112.44 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: $UCID: Uni-Charm Indonesia plans to buy one MC12-type machine from its parent Unicharm Corporation for IDR 112.44 billion. The machine will be used to produce the Charm Safe Night product directly, allowing cost-of-goods-sold efficiencies.

tickerNews.title: IPCM to distribute interim dividend of 20.05 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: $IPCM: Jasa Armada Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend of IDR 20.05 billion, equivalent to IDR 3.8 per share. The cumulative dividend will be paid on the regular market and negotiated market on 5 January 2024, with payment on 26 January 2024. Based on IPCM's closing price of IDR 284 per share on Tuesday (2/1), the implied dividend yield is 1.33%.

tickerNews.title: BSDE purchases vacant land of about 2,134 sqm from Smartfren Telecom subsidiary
tickerNews.content: $BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai purchases vacant land of approximately 2,134 square meters from Smartfren Telecom subsidiary PT Smart Telecom for IDR 16.4 billion. The land is located in CBD BSD Lot 12A, South Tangerang. The transaction is funded from BSDE's internal cash.
